paper_abstract: This letter is to present an adaptive compensation zero circuit to achieve good transient response in current-mode DC-DC buck converter. The proposed structure introduces an adaptive resistance dynamically adjusted according to the different output load conditions, which achieves an adequate system phase margin. A monolithic DC-DC buck converter using the proposed structure was fabricated with 0.35 mu m CMOS process. Measurement results show that the transient undershoot/overshoot voltage and the recovery time do not exceed 60 mV and 20 mu s for a load current variation from 0 to 1 A.
paper_title: Fast transient DC-DC converter with adaptive compensation zero technique
